quizzes.question: JavaScript's main function is:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Welcome to JavaScript[/h1]

JavaScript adds [b]interactivity [/b]to a webpage.

JavaScript works together with [b]HTML [/b]and [b]CSS [/b]to create attractive, interactive websites. [img id="2724" width="100%"]
[note]Before starting with JavaScript, it is recommended that you gain basic knowledge of [b]HTML [/b]and [b]CSS[/b]. Check out the SoloLearn [b]HTML[/b] and [b]CSS [/b]Tutorials. They're free![/note]

quizzes.question: When used in a web page, JavaScript runs:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Using JavaScript[/h1]

When used in a web page, the JavaScript scripting language works inside the [b]web browser[/b]. [img id="2726" width="100%"]
Here are a few examples of what you can do with JavaScript:
- [b]Display [/b]information based on the time of day
- [b]Detect [/b]the visitor's browser
- [b]Validate [/b]forms data
- [b]Create [/b]cookies
- [b]Change [/b]page contents dynamically
- and much [b]more[/b]!
[note]The coming lessons will cover all of the techniques needed to make exciting, dynamic, easily updated webpages using JavaScript.[/note]

quizzes.question: JavaScript, as a client-side scripting language, runs:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Client Side Language[/h1]

Website scripts run either [b]client side[/b] or [b]server side[/b]. 
The client-side of a website refers to the web browser that is viewing it. The server-side of a website is the server that hosts it.

PHP, Ruby on Rails, ASP.NET are among the most popular server side languages. They are called server side languages because their scripts run on the server that hosts the website, rather than on the user's computer.

JavaScript is a [b]Client Side Scripting Language[/b]. 
It runs [b]on your computer [/b]after you've loaded the web page containing the script. [img id="2727" width="100%"]

answers.text: Yes, in Adobe applications or Node.js server-side applications
No, JavaScript is solely a client-side language

quizzes.question: Is JavaScript used in general purpose and server-side applications?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Other Uses of JavaScript[/h1]

As previously mentioned, JavaScript was designed to run as a scripting language, inside the web browser. 

But, as JavaScript has become popular, you can find it in other [b]applications [/b](e.g.: Adobe Acrobat) and even[b] server-side [/b](e.g.: Node.js) products. [img id="2728" width="100%"]
[note]In this tutorial we are going to talk about [b]classic JavaScript[/b], a[b] client side language[/b]  that adds [b]interactivity [/b]to web pages. 
Learning the core of the language will enable you to create the program you desire, whether client-side or server-side.[/note]
